title: Social Art Director
content:
Overview
An integral part of our SL&E team, the Social Art Director will lead the visual direction and design of Beverage client SL&E JSK OU social media efforts. This person should possess a strong artistic vision, a deep understanding of social media platforms and a keen eye for visual storytelling. It is also expected of the SAD to collaborate with cross functional teams to supervise and create visually compelling and engaging content that resonates with Beverage client JSK OU audiences.  
Responsibilities

Conceptualize and develop visual strategies for social media campaigns across OU  
Lead the design and execution of high quality, innovative, visually striking content across social media platforms that is inline with Beverage brand CI, look and feel.  
Understands and have deep knowledge of how best to use different formats on social media – static, videos, GIFS, animations, and adoption of new design tools and techniques  
Ensures that all creative assets are optimized to each social platform’s specs and adhere to the best practices for engagement  
Work closely with




copywriters, designers, photo/videographers and other team members to ensure cohesive and effective visual communication 
social media team to understand campaign goals, target audience, messaging, and translate them into compelling visuals  




Assess global charter/campaign content and provide assessment on whether localization by OU or market level required, along with design approach  
Develop and maintain visual identity and brand consistency across all social media channels  
Stay up to date with design trends, social media best practices and platform developments to optimize content for maximum impact  
Create moodboards, storyboards, prototypes or design mock ups to present visual concepts and ideas  
Direct photo/video shoots and other creative content production to ensure delivery is as per concept and ideation  
Review and provide feedback on content created by other team members to ensure alignment with the visual direction e.g. content creators, influencers, etc  
Act as mentor to junior designers, providing guidance, feedback and support as/when relevant or needed    
Lead and develop visual/video production submission for awards as/when required, to ensure high chances of success  

Requirements

Bachelor's degree in Graphic Design, Visual Arts, or a related field (or equivalent work experience) are good to have
Min. 4-5 years of proven experience as an Art Director, Visual Designer or a similar role, with track record of successful social campaigns and portfolio showcasing a range of creative and engaging campaigns  
Proficiency in graphic design software such as Adobe Creative Suite (Photoshop, Illustrator, InDesign, etc)  
Strong understanding of social media platforms, its capabilities and design requirements 
Exceptional creativity, conceptual thinking, attention to detail
Strong communication and collaboration skills to work effectively in a fast paced, complicated dynamic matrix between teams, agencies, client  
Knowledge of video editing, motion graphics and animation pool is a plus  
Experience with photography, directing photoshoots is a bonus  
Business level or above in English and Japanese are good to have skill

About Us
VML & Ogilvy Japan GK was established in April 2019 as a partnership between Geometry Global and The Ogilvy Group to enhance our offering to brands in Japan in support of their business ambitions and marketing objectives. We believe in the power of creativity to drive meaningful change that delivers positive business outcomes. Now more than ever the ability for an agency to flex and adapt to clients changing needs is vital in the application of communications, brand experience, commerce and technology. Our blend of global and local expertise and marketing capability is designed to meet the challenges of today while setting our clients up for success from tomorrow and beyond. VML & Ogilvy Japan GK is a WPP company (NASDAQ: WWPGY).
VML & Ogilvy Japan GK embraces and celebrates diversity, inclusivity, and equal opportunity. We are committed to building a team that represents a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. We are a worldwide creative agency that represents global clients. The more inclusive we are, the more brilliant work we can create together.At Ogilvy, our people are at the heart of what we do: a creative agency that sparks game-changing ideas across culture and business through collaboration, integrity, and a celebration of self-expression. 
We believe in building powerful teams with purpose. This means hiring and nurturing talent across all races, ethnicities, religions, abilities, sexual orientation, and gender identities – and we relentlessly curate transformative initiatives that make our commitment to fairness, and equity a reality. 
Our ultimate mission is to leave a positive impact on the world, creating a better future for all, while supporting and uplifting the global communities we serve.  This is central to our mantra of Borderless Creativity.
All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran.
